qas.question: What type of art did Courbet, Manet, Monet and Renoir create?
What was the purpose of the 1889 Universal Exposition?

answers.text: to mark the centennial of the French Revolution

qas.question: Where was the Eiffel Tower revealed?
What type of art was created by Charles Baudelaire and Paul Verlaine?

context: Late in the 19th century, Paris hosted two major international expositions: the <a2_0>1889 Universal Exposition<a2_0/>, was held <a1_0>to mark the centennial of the French Revolution<a1_0/> and featured the new Eiffel Tower; and the 1900 Universal Exposition, which gave Paris the Pont Alexandre III, the Grand Palais, the Petit Palais and the first Paris Métro line. Paris became the laboratory of Naturalism (Émile Zola) and <a3_0>Symbolism<a3_0/> (Charles Baudelaire and Paul Verlaine), and of <a0_0>Impressionism<a0_0/> in art (Courbet, Manet, Monet, Renoir.)
